Key Match Events: Tim Hardaway Jr. tied the game with a jumper with 3:39 to play, then hit a 3-pointer to make it 109-106
After the teams traded baskets, Anfernee Simons hit a layup to make it a one-point game
Malik Beasley hit a 3-pointer to put the Pistons ahead 114-110
Deandre Ayton dunked for Portland with 49.5 seconds to go
Duren’s putback restored the four-point lead
Pre-Game Insights: Coach Chauncey Billups was honored before the game for his contributions to Detroit’s 2004 championship and his induction into the Basketball Hall of Fame
Post-Match Reflections: The Pistons haven’t been.500 after New Year’s since it finished 41-41 in 2018-19. That season, Blake Griffin led the Pistons to the playoffs, but injured his knee in the process and they were swept by Milwaukee.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Portland outscored the Pistons 17-0 in the first three minutes of the second quarter, helped by four straight 3-pointers from Sharpe and Simons
Detroit went 19 of 22 from the free-throw line while Portland was 3 of 5
